attributes.action: oppose the proposed logo for the London 2012 Olympics.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The 2012 Olympic logo was revealed yesterday (5th June, 2006) as a "vibrant" and "innovative" icon for the 2012 games. With a £400k price-tag, is this not a little too much for something that is so easily created on microsoft word (http://www.b3ta.com/board/7253579)? 
The budget is already more than initially projected, isn't it wise that we should be cutting corners? It is for this reason I propose a national competition where people of all ages and creeds design the logo, with the final top 10 being put to the public vote. Let's at least give someone an opportunity of a lifetime and help fund the games in the process.

So I ask you. Does the logo show an English pride? No. 
Does it show off our wonderfully vibrant culture and society? No. 
Most importantly of all, do "we" as a nation like it?

If you feel the same way, please sign this petition to rethink the 2012 logo.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
